Description: Necklace: composed of many truncated convex bicone disc and a few barrel disc beads of cornelian, two long cylindrical beads and one disc bead of steatite, one gold bicone and three cornelian amulets. The amulets consist of a broken hand amulet and two leg-with-foot amulets; the latter are side-pierced.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hammamia, Grave 1953 Found at the neck
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' II (London, 1927-30), Tomb register, pl.LX; Bead register, pl.LXXII; Bead corpus, pl.XCIV, 8B9 (hand); I0M15, 24 (legs).
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (327)
